title: How the Guardian’s engineering team supports the 24 hour news cycle
description:
Managing the out of hours engineer support rota to meet the demands of a global news operation

News happens 24 hours a day, seven days a week. It’s essential our audience can access our journalism at all times, we cannot have any disruption to our service.

Whilst we build our software for reliability through the use of microservices and removal of single points of failure, occasionally we need an engineer to take a look at a problem out of regular working hours. With complex software and integration across a wide variety of systems, it’s not possible to predict all technical failures.

At first glance this might seem like overkill, but it’s extremely useful if the call is made in the early hours of the morning

Where can I find open positions?
